fields.description:
The dashboard on 4.2.1, at least, has a poor indication of branch builds executing; provided that the master is green, the branch build can be happily running in the background with no noticeable indication that its actually running.

This is mostly an issue where branches are used for release-quality builds – its conceivable that the dashboard may not want to indicate every concurrent feature branch (as per a git flow model), but in an ideal world, the dashboard would indicate branches not as the floating lightbox from the branch icon, but as a disclosure triangle, and the closed state of the build-line would indicate if _any_ branch build was executing.
fields.summary: Branch builds in 4.2.1 not showing plan as "building" on Dashboard

fields.description: Any branch which has a - in the name will not show as a branch in the UI.
fields.summary: Current Activity Page doesn't always show branches as branches

fields.description:
For automatic branch detection Bamboo assumes that a user has organized his repository this way:
{code}
/project-a/trunk
/project-a/branches
/project-a/tags
/project-b/trunk
/project-b/branches
/project-b/tags
{code}

This is pretty standard and works fine with automatic branch detection in Bamboo 4.2. The user can set the repository location to /project-a/trunk, and it will look for branches in /project-a/branches. However, users have been considering an alternate repository layout that looks like this:
{code}
/trunk/project-a
/trunk/project-b
/branches/<branch-name>/project-a
/branches/<branch-name>/project-b
{code}

This would allow him to create a branch that encompasses multiple related projects, all of which will be modified together in that branch, instead of creating separate but inter-dependent branches under each project's own trunk/branches/tags structure.

However, this structure doesn't work well with Bamboo. The user can configure it to look for branches of project-a under /branches, but then Bamboo thinks /branches/<branch-name> is a branch of project-a. In reality, the branched version of project-a is one level deeper at /branches/<branch-name>/project-a.
fields.summary: Provide flexibility in choosing a repository branch path

fields.description:
When I have a dependent build, sometimes the trigger for the parent build is reported incorrectly. For instance if Plan B is dependent upon Plan A, but Plan A is triggered by a checkin, on the dashboard it reports that "Triggered by child Plan B". This is incorrect and appears intermittently.

We have a CI plan that is triggered by svn and a Release plan that is triggered by the successful completion of the CI plan. I have observed that it sometimes reports that the CI plan was triggered by the Release plan. This seems like odd behavior, because if I manually trigger a Release build it does not trigger a CI plan.
fields.summary: Bamboo incorrectly reports reason why build was triggered.

fields.description:
Given the setup:
* Bamboo 4.2.1 on both systems
* Export from Windows
* Import to CentOS 5.5
* Login attempts made by user "bamboo" and "Bamboo" on the Windows instance

Inside of the export zip, file db-export/loginInfos.xml contained two entries for a user that varied in case:
  <loginInfo>
   <userName>bamboo</userName>
   <authCount>1</authCount>
   <authTimestamp>1348462800000</authTimestamp>
  </loginInfo>
  <loginInfo>
   <userName>Bamboo</userName>
   <authCount>3</authCount>
   <authTimestamp>1348635600000</authTimestamp>
  </loginInfo>

This caused the import to fail while creating the AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO table. Deleting these two entries allowed the bamboo backup to be imported.
fields.summary: Case sensitive userName in loginInfos.xml breaks import

fields.description:
Allow having variables in the job requirements and remote agent capabilities so that by changing a value of one variable (which can possibly be used in many job requirements) a user can change the agents that satisfies the requirements. 

Variables in job requirements could also allow to run / not run a job based on which branch is currently being built, probably by using the variable ${bamboo.repository.branch.name}

h3. Workaround
The problem that is highlighted in this issue can be reduced to modifying effective configuration of multiple plans with a simple change in Bamboo configuration (editing global variable). 
We believe that Bamboo allows for such behavior with use of [Bamboo Specs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-specs-894743906.html]. Moving configuration of Bamboo plans to code allows modifying configuration of multiple Plans at the same time and much more.
fields.summary: Allow having variables in agent capabilities and job requirements

fields.description: The SCP task currently supports only uploads an artifact to an external server. Let's update the task, or add a companion task, that handles the reverse direction. fields.description:
Bamboo 4.1.2:

We have 5 agents with the following capabilities:
Agent1: A, B
Agent2: A, B
Agent3: A, B
Agent4: A, B
Agent5: A, B, X

We have Agent 2 and 3 busy, and a long running job (40 minutes) that needs capabilities A.

What happens for us is that the long running job takes Server 5, and blocks other jobs that needs capability X, event thougu Agent1 and Agent4 is free for use.

Suggested new Algorithm for selecting agent:
1. Find all idle Agents which support our needed capabilities
2. Sort them on the number of capabilities, select the one with fewest capabilities
3. If there are more than one with the fewest: select the one among them with fewest unique capabilities
fields.summary: Improve agent selection algorithm in Bamboo

fields.description:
It would be beneficial to allow (during manual stage triggering) for the definition of required/optional variable inputs that would be provided by the user who triggers the stage.

For example, one of our manual stages is to post the build artifact as a release download. Once this has completed, we have a script that runs out and determines the next development version (ie. when releasing 1.4.4, it might be 1.4.5, or 1.5.0, etc.) and updates one of our build files.

When triggering this particular manual build stage, it would be nice to define an input/variable, say "Next Development Version" / $nextDevVersion that could be provided by the user (via a dialog/text box when triggering the stage), and be made available in tasks for that particular build or stage.
fields.summary: Required/Optional Textual Inputs for Manual Build Stages

fields.description:
The Hibernate version we're using is not really good at proper detection of actual state of indexes on DB columns on some DB engines and it tries to recreate them every time.
{code}
[SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: alter table AUTHOR add constraint author_author_name_key unique (AUTHOR_NAME)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,565 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-02261: such unique or primary key already exists in the table

2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: create index author_name_idx on AUTHOR (AUTHOR_NAME)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: create index trust_apps_app_id_idx on TRUSTED_APPS (APP_ID)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: create index uuid_idx on AGENT_AUTHENTICATION (UUID)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: create index branch_commit_branch_id_idx on BRANCH_COMMIT_INFO (BRANCH_ID)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,580 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

2012-09-18 15:56:34,596 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: alter table BUILD add constraint full_key_unique unique (FULL_KEY)
2012-09-18 15:56:34,596 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [SchemaUpdate] ORA-02261: such unique or primary key already exists in the table

fields.description: User should be able to connect to Stash/Bitbucket/Github and have Shared Repositories created for all repositories accessible from the account.
fields.summary: Create shared repositories using OAuth to Github, Bitbucket and Stash

fields.description: A user logged in as an administrator gets a 'Permission denied" error when attempting to save a Clover license (see screenshot). A user logged in as system administrator can successfully apply a Clover license. A regular administrator should be able to perform this action.
fields.summary: Permission error when attempting to save Clover license in Bamboo OnDemand

fields.description:
IN Bamboo if i go to admin section and select "Groups" under the security subsection I go to the manage groups page. Under the create group section there is a Save / Cancel buttons. Directly above the buttons is the text "Add new users to the group by clicking on the user picker icon above". When it says "user picker icon" I do not see an icon on the page. Does this mean the "users to add" text field?

Not sure if this is just a phrasing issue or there used to be an actual icon on the page.

If I go to EDIT an existing group the Edit Group page also the wording "Add new users to the group by clicking on the user picker icon above" where it mentions an ICON.
fields.summary: Minor Text Correction of Bamboo Admin 'Groups' management page

fields.description: Provide an option to expire a particular artifact after the build has been completed to save disk space. This is useful in situations where the artifact is only used to share resources between stages (such as a single checkout or a unit test artifact) that is not needed after the build has completed.
fields.summary: Expire some artifacts after build has been completed

fields.summary: Handle the agent capability deletion NullPointerException

fields.description:
See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Release+management+with+Bamboo

Needs an in-house diagram!
fields.summary: Finish the Release management page

fields.description: Would that be possible add a component in Bamboo to detect if there is a third party plugin installed, and if Bamboo fails because of that plugin? In that case we need to show a different error message and suggest to contact the owner of that plugin instead of contacting Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Implement detection of third party - unsupported plugin failures

fields.summary: Cannot export or backup

fields.description:
Currently logging for {{com.atlassian.bamboo.filter.AccessLogFilter}} is set to INFO in OnDemand.

This results in extremely verbose logs and is of limited usefulness to us since:
* we have Apache access logs, and
* we can jump into a customer's instance to verify reported problems.
fields.summary: Set AccessLogFilter log level to WARN by default in OnDemand

fields.description: Currently Bamboo allows to check Results, Artifacts and Build logs to be checked to be included in the export. However, Scheduled Backups have the checkbox only for Artifacts.
fields.summary: Allow the same flexibility for Scheduled Backups the same way as we have for Export

fields.description:
Newly created branches can have key that was used previously by another deleted branch. This causes problems with repositoryData files in xml-data/build-dir/repositoryData which are not deleted upon branch deletion (because these are scattered on agents)

see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-8149
fields.summary: Branch creation process might conflict with files in xml-data/build-dir/repositoryData

fields.description: Use https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/bamboo-hg/components/bamboo-language/src/main/resources/help-paths.properties?r=HEAD
fields.summary: Check that all help links have a target in the Bamboo help-paths.properties file

fields.description: In the Javadoc for PlansGreenCondition at http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-bamboo/4.2/com/atlassian/bamboo/buildtrigger/PlansGreenCondition.html the method getExecutionPreference(ImmutablePlan plan) has a description : "Use to indicate preference for whether this plugin things the plan should execute." I assume the word "things" should be replaced by "thinks".
fields.summary: Small Typo in JavaDoc for PlansGreenCondition Class

fields.description:
You can see linked Bamboo builds at the project level, but branch plans are arguably much better way to link things to a JIRA project / verion. It would be nice to aggregate them and show the latest ones at the project level



(Chai raised for Glenn)
fields.summary: JBAM plugin should show branch plans at the project level

fields.description: In Bamboo we currently can add an Amazon EC2 as elastic agent to Bamboo. It will be nice to have a feature that will allow users with Microsoft Azure account to use it as elastic agents.
fields.summary: Windows Azure elastic instance

fields.description: At the moment our checkout strategy for git is to fetch particular branches. However some of the customers would like to have possibility to execute regular clone operation (see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-8019)
fields.summary: Add support for clone repository in bamboo-git-plugin
Provide a global environment variable to calculate branches root

fields.description:
Build has a manual stage with one job . All jobs in previous stages are disabled. Kick off the build, it goes green; not obvious how to get to a screen were I could kick off the manual stage.

WORKAROUND:
go back a build click on that manual job and then go forward a build (by clicking on the top right)
fields.summary: Cannot easily trigger a manual stage if all jobs in previos stages are disabled

fields.description:
For one thing, this link is viewable. (I don't really think it should be)

Secondly it redirects in a very bad way.

https://rotp-jall.jira-dev.com/buildshttps://rotp-jall.jira-dev.com/builds/plugins/servlet/stp/view/
fields.summary: Atlassian Support Tools link should not be viewable in the bamboo admin section

fields.description: Not having the latest HTTP client is causing dependency conflicts for plugin developers.
fields.summary: Upgrade to HTTP Client 4.x

fields.description:
In the Javadoc for the class com.atlassian.bamboo.jira.jiraissues.JiraIssueUtils

There are several minor typos in the Javadoc. For the 2 methods named findIssueKeysInText they contain the description "Find the and JIRA issue keys within the given string. " I'm guessing the 'and' should be removed so it reads : "Find the JIRA issue keys within the given string."
fields.summary: Small Typos In JavaDoc for JiraIssueUtils class.

fields.description:
I've installed Bamboo server on Windows 7 64-bit. When I attempt to download  the remote agent JAR using Firefox (under the same machine as the server) from http://my-server/admin/agent/addRemoteAgent.action the download hangs at 99% done and never completes.

If I use wget to download from a Ubuntu machine the download hangs at the same point, then a couple of seconds later reports "Connection closed at byte 97052164. Retrying."

I have disabled all firewalls and anti-viruses. One final thing I noticed:

1. If I download the file using the server's public hostname (going over a pubic-facing router), the download hangs.
2. If I download using the server's internal IP, the download works.

Thing is, I don't experience this problem with any other application. I am fairly sure that Bamboo is doing something wrong, like violating the HTTP protocol, causing the router to block communication.

My router is a WRT45G v2 running Firmware DD-WRT v24-sp2 (02/09/10) std-nokaid. How do I debug this further?
fields.summary: Hang downloading Remote Agent

fields.description: "Enable Commit Isolation" shows up twice when adding a new item in the "Shared Source Repositories" page.
fields.summary: "Enable Commit Isolation" shows up twice

fields.description:
When clover2:check is run, clover will check against the history file and fail the build if current code coverage is less than what is stored in the history. This is great, but Bamboo does not know why a build fails in this situation. Bamboo reports the following in the 'Build Summary' tab: "No failed tests found, a possible compilation error occurred."

If you drill down into the log, you see that the build has failed due to lower code coverage. With the integration of Clover and Bamboo it would be reasonable to expect an error message along the lines of "Build failed due to code coverage".

To Recreate:
-Take any project, add clover to the pom.
-run mvn clover2:setup test clover2:aggregate clover2:clover clover2:save-history
-Forcibly reduce the code coverage in some way
-run same command as before, but add clover2:check at the end

Bamboo should be able to give pertinent error message when Clover fails a build based on coverage.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not know why Clover is failing build (code ratcheting)

fields.description:
In the Bamboo admin Audit Log screen there are 3 buttons "Disable Audit Logging" and "Delete All Audit Logs" and "Delete All Global Audit Logs".

It would be nice when these 3 buttons are clicked if unique events were thrown and a matching listener and notification type could then make then as available System Notifications for admins to opt-in to.

In many Enterprise environments there are multiple Bamboo Admin users and it would be nice to get an email alert if someone accidentally or intentionally disables/deletes audit logging.
fields.summary: Notification and Event when Global Audit Logs Are Disabled and Deleted

fields.description:
I have a plan with a Stage flagged as Manual. I had the build set to run once nightly. The build ran all the stages/jobs until it got to the manual stage. It sat unnoticed for a few days. I then went and DELETED the manual stage in the plan config. Later I noticed the paused build. I went to the build result page and saw "PENDING STAGE" with a Run button next to it. I clicked the Run button and the page refreshed to a :

An unexpected error has occurred

Error encountered while triggering manual build: null

Plan 'BOOTEST-BOOTEST' did not start

I understand the manual stage has been deleted so I did not expect it work or run, however it should be able to better handle this scenario where the manual stage is gone.
fields.summary: Running a Paused Manual Stage Breaks If Manual Stage is No Longer there.

fields.description:
Today my plan got disabled due to missing branch error (I've removed branch from git repository). I wanted to configure notifications to get mail in such situation but I see that there is no option for that.

Why this is important? If we aren't getting notifications from bamboo then we assume that test builds without problems, so we doesn't check plan status in bamboo - and then we can continue development for few days until someone will spot that our plan is disabled... and not knowing for few days that test fails is a big issue.
fields.summary: I want to get notification when plan branch is automatically disabled

fields.description:
When our Bamboo instance is under high load and the UI is struggling, I often like to cheat, take advantage of Bamboo's predictable URLs, and go straight to wherever I'm going.  

Currently in my team we're using too many branch builds, so if I want to go to a branch build I usually have to go to a few intermediary screens to actually get there.  It would be nice if I could just go straight to the screen by cheating and adding the URL, but the URLs for branch builds are unguessable.

Please add a ?branch="branch-name" parameter that redirects to the URL for a given branch.
fields.summary: Provide humanly derivable URL to branch builds.

fields.summary: Disable fast forward merges for Git

fields.description: If I have a repository setup on the gatekeeper, with multiple branches, committing to two branches at nearly the same time will trigger both branches to build. One branch will finish before the other, and therefore push the remote HEAD forward. If the second build cannot merge as a fast-forward, it will fail to merge and fail to build. Simply re-running the second build will result in success because it will pull the changes that the first pushed on success. A safer strategy would be to not allow multiple branches to run if they are set to push on success.
fields.summary: Branch merging with gatekeeper and push on causes git failures with concurrent builds

fields.description:
Slowness is detected on UI navigation

We know that the issue is related to the number of Git Processes that are created by the Git repos change detection.

As a workaround the following options can be applied:
1. Remove the Server Native Git capability. This will force JGit to be used.
2. Reduce the number of threads available for change detection. This will reduce the number of Git processes created:

At file /conf/wrapper.conf file, under the "wrapper.java.additional" section, add the following line:
{code}
wrapper.java.additional.X=-Dbamboo.plan.exe.threads=3
{code}
Where X is next number of the "wrapper.java.additional" sequence and "3" is the number of threads available for repo change detection. The default value of the system property is 7.
fields.summary: When Bamboo is Installed on EC2, Using Native Git Makes The Server Slow
